constructor.details: The pool's creationCode is used to deploy pools via CREATE3

params.pauseWindowDuration: The period ( starting from deployment of this factory ) during which pools can be paused and unpaused
params.vault: The contract instance of the Vault

params.liquidityManagement: Liquidity management flags with implemented methods
params.name: The name of the pool
params.poolHooksContract: Contract that implements the hooks for the pool
params.protocolFeeExempt: true, the pool's initial aggregate fees will be set to 0
params.roleAccounts: Addresses the Vault will allow to change certain pool settings
params.salt: The salt value that will be passed to create3 deployment
params.tokens: An array of descriptors for the tokens the pool will manage

disable().details: Existing pools are unaffected. Once a factory is disabled, it cannot be re-enabled.

params.selector: The 4-byte selector of the permissioned function

returns._0: An interface pointer to the Authorizer

getDefaultLiquidityManagement().details: Users can call this to create a structure with all false arguments, then set the ones they need to true.

params.salt: The salt used to deploy the pool

returns._0: deploymentAddress The predicted address of the pool, given the salt

getNewPoolPauseWindowEndTime().details: We intend for all pools deployed by this factory to have the same pause window end time (i.e., after this date, all future pools will be unpausable). This function will return `_poolsPauseWindowEndTime` until it passes, after which it will return 0.

returns._0: The resolved pause window end time (0 indicating it's no longer pausable)
The end time as a timestamp
An interface pointer to the Vault
success True if this factory was disabled
success True if `pool` was created by this factory

constructor.notice: The pool creationCode cannot be changed after the factory has been deployed

create(string,string,bytes32,(address,ui.notice: Deploys a new pool and registers it with the vault

disable().notice: Disable the factory, preventing the creation of more pools.

getActionId(bytes4).notice: Returns the action identifier associated with the external function described by `selector`.

getAuthorizer().notice: Get the address of the Authorizer.

getDefaultLiquidityManagement().notice: Convenience function for constructing a LiquidityManagement object.

getDefaultPoolHooksContract().notice: A common place to retrieve a default hooks contract. Currently set to address(0) (i.e. no hooks).

getDeploymentAddress(bytes32).notice: Return the address where a new pool will be deployed, based on the factory address and salt.

getNewPoolPauseWindowEndTime().notice: Returns the current pauseWindowEndTime that will be applied to Pools created by this factory.

getOriginalPauseWindowEndTime().notice: Returns the original factory pauseWindowEndTime, regardless of the current time.

getPauseWindowDuration().notice: Return the pause window duration. This is the time pools will be pausable after factory deployment.

getVault().notice: Get the address of the Balancer Vault.

isDisabled().notice: Check whether this factory has been disabled by governance.

isPoolFromFactory(address).notice: Check whether a pool was deployed by this factory.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (address,struct TokenConfig memory[] memory,uint256,bool,struct PoolRoleAccounts memory,address,struct LiquidityManagement memory)
